channel.title: Comments on: Energy Efficient Clothes Dryer – Well there is one but it makes too much sense

item.title: By: Clothesline
item.dc:creator: Clothesline
item.description: You have explained very well the European and American style options to dry clothes. I also suggest not electric drying your clothes because over time it weakens the fabric and resins of the fabrics in turn making clothes look old in a short period of time. Drying them in the sun is the best option. Portable clotheslines, racks and folding frames are readily available in the marketplace; you just need to see which one best fits your space and looks good, as well.http://www.breezedryer.com/
item.content:encoded:
You have explained very well the European and American style options to dry clothes. I also suggest not electric drying your clothes because over time it weakens the fabric and resins of the fabrics in turn making clothes look old in a short period of time. Drying them in the sun is the best option.
Portable clotheslines, racks and folding frames are readily available in the marketplace; you just need to see which one best fits your space and looks good, as well.http://www.breezedryer.com/

item.title: By: ctournet
item.dc:creator: ctournet
item.description: There is a clothes dryer alternative called a spin dryer, which uses approximately 1/100th of the energy that a conventional tumble dryer does. More information is available at http://www.laundry-alternative.com/spin_dryer_release.htm
item.content:encoded:
There is a clothes dryer alternative called a spin dryer, which uses approximately 1/100th of the energy that a conventional
tumble dryer does. More information is available at
http://www.laundry-alternative.com/spin_dryer_release.htm
